breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: Under the light of awakening, we walk with trust in the unfolding intelligence of life. We devote ourselves to regeneration, restoring the fabric of earth and the essence of humanity. We know that collaboration is the true architecture of evolution, where unity becomes strength, and diversity becomes harmony. We choose love as our compass, and integrity as our plan. We honor coherence, weaving finance, technology, and governance into service of life itself. We uphold well-being as our prime directive, the measure of prosperity, and the essence of all enterprise. We embody courage, walking boldly through uncertainty, guided by vision and conviction. the of the world begins within. We declare our task to be that of planetary regeneration.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: So the purpose is our intention, is our collective intention, is why we got here all together. And, and that is that collective intention, but the vision, where are we going with this, a regenerative planetary civilization, where human purpose, finance, and technology unite in service to life itself. And how are we going to get there? This is our mission. By catalyzing humanity transition to regenerative civilization, by building integrated financial, digital, physical, and cultural infrastructure, that enables coherent and collective action at a planetary scale. So integrating financial, digital, physical, and cultural infrastructure. And that's our way of getting to that vision. And I hope this vision, this purpose. know. it this purpose. is inspiring enough for us collectively to take this action forward.

And it takes courage, it takes love, it takes reminding us what is this all about, why we came together. It's not easy. I mean, every one of us is in a different country, different place. So, just putting a seed there, that whatever has been shared... is a work in progress. there's a huge uncertainty. and especially at the beginning. and we have two choices to play with uncertainty. either we celebrate it with knowing that there is magic will unfold at some point of time and have the courage to walk through that uncertainty or we can embrace it with with concern and this is a choice that we make personally and we can make this choice but also we can make the other choice and this is for me here an invitation to embrace uncertainty and and for us collectively and I the responsibility for a better communication, starting with myself, and a clear communication. Because if anybody on this call says that I know exactly all the steps that we need to walk in the next six months or next one year or whatever it is, that's not true because nobody does. But we only know something, and that something is that we have a very strong connection of why we started this. And we know that we will face challenges and uncertainties, and we have to figure it out, including how to work together and how we align internally. It's especially when you try to distribute power. It's easy when... In a startup, they launch a company, and one guy is named a founder, and then you keep running, and then you get this guy and the other guy, and so on, you know, that's easy. Some of you here are entrepreneurs, they've done that. That's actually easy. This is difficult. So, embracing this with an open heart, and this message for me first, and for you second. So, invite you to embrace that.

breakthroughs.text: On the compensation part, right? I mean, the thing is, like I said before as well, when I first came and saw how things were working so far, to be honest, I was quite uncomfortable. didn't make sense for me at all, right, in the way things were so far, because, and this is, again, my personal views of this, nothing has been discussed, where I would look at it in a very simple way, that time being spent has to be valued. How you value it, there can be multiple frameworks, whether it's for a role, whether it's for the person, where they are, and so on and so forth, needs to be valued. One variable can be what are the resources that we have currently that we can afford? How much can we, from a practical standpoint, defer it out? I really think understanding what... Regenerative is having a common understanding of what it is and what it isn't, understanding that we are not going to be regenerative on day one, and we need to go through horizon two transformation, and that we are making decisions sometimes which are horizon two minus, sometimes horizon two plus, and that those decisions can be made explicitly and intentionally. Regenerative, finally, having, trying to understand what is the, who is the, and I don't mean necessarily an individual person, but who is the guide, the holding the feet to the fire from a regenerative point of view? So, I'll leave that. I just think we need to go a bit deeper into this whole word and what it really means.

And a lot of things even, like, probably planned for the literally next hundred days might be overkill and need to be scaled down to be, like, way more realistic. So that not just we are capable of doing this, but also that we not feel overloaded every time we look into any plans and milestones and trying to assess things we can't possibly assess at the moment. And to be okay with that, as in, like, move slow. But in a more cohesive and calm way, achieving more, actually, while moving slower, but really having enough time and space for us to have transparent, heart-to-heart communications at all times, recognizing that we all have our personal, business, collective interests, and sometimes they will come in conflict, and that is just okay.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: We came back from Tuscany in the first meeting that we had. The vision, mission, and the creed that Shyamana just beautifully read out were kind of formally adopted as the underlying basis for Better World. The core values also were finalized. Since we still are to put in place a more robust governance framework, for now we agreed to essentially follow holacracy principles to be adopted as an interim governance framework.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: A provisional anchor circle was formed, and I want to highlight the word provisional. This basically is just taking some of the founders or the legal directors of some of the entities within the MBS who came part of the anchor circle.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: Farhad brought to the table that we should update the corporate structure, what Alex had presented at the gathering, to also create another separate legal entity that we are calling as Better World Private Equity Limited.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: The Anchor Circle said that we'd rather start using what we've built.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: We also had Selvajia from TechBricks join that meeting to review the product. And we agreed that while the product is in an alpha stage, we can at least still start using some parts of it.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: The legal sub-circle charter was adopted and approved by the anchor circle, with IRS agreeing to take the lead on this.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: We also voted on the purpose through Symbiosis, so I think it worked, even though people struggled a bit to understand how to use it.

decisions.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
decisions.text: So, we decided, okay, well, we will postpone or delay that integration. And therefore, Anastasia decided that it's not the right time to put her energy and time into this.

recommendations.text: Encourage more balanced participation, as a few speakers dominate the conversation. Consider using structured turn-taking or inviting quieter members to speak.
Increase active listening and feedback instances to boost overall engagement. Promote phrases like 'I hear you' or 'that's a good point' to validate contributions.
Address the low pronoun ratio by actively encouraging collective language ('we', 'us') to foster a more inclusive and team-oriented mindset. The current ratio leans individualistic.
Improve speaking equity by ensuring all voices are heard more evenly. The Gini coefficient suggests some speakers contribute significantly more than others.

For topics with low consensus (e.g., Compensation and Contribution, Holacracy and Governance), dedicate specific time to address disagreements and hesitations. Use structured decision-making frameworks to move towards clearer agreement.

Prioritize addressing explicit knowledge gaps identified, particularly regarding operational efficiency, holacracy principles, and the lead for governance/communication circles. Assign clear owners and deadlines to find this information.
Improve knowledge coverage in 'Market & Competition', 'Legal & Compliance', and 'Customer/Stakeholder Needs' domains. These areas show limited discussion depth and confidence.

Encourage a more collaborative power dynamic by promoting low-power language (questions, hedges) and reducing high-power language (commands, directives) where appropriate, especially for speakers with high power percentages.
Focus on building stronger relational health, particularly in trust and alignment, during the middle phases of the meeting. Implement practices that foster vulnerability and shared understanding.

Improve communication clarity and transparency, especially regarding the Anchor Circle's decisions and ongoing work. Utilize Symbiosis for regular updates and Q&A to reduce parallel discussions and confusion.
Finalize circle charters and roles ASAP to clarify responsibilities and enable more effective workload distribution. This will help integrate contributions from all members.
Schedule the proposed 3-4 hour MVS integration and tech infrastructure alignment call urgently to address overlapping functionalities and create a cohesive product offering.
